TRACTION.Definition: the fact of an idea, product, etc. becoming popular or being accepted

‍ENTREPRENEURS.Definition: people who starts their own business, especially when this involves seeing a new opportunity

‍PROGRAMMERS.Definition: people whose job is to produce computer programs

‍SHAREHOLDERS.Definition: people who own shares in a company and therefore get part of the company's profits and the right to vote on how the company is controlled

‍COUNTERACT.Definition: to reduce or remove the effect of something unwanted by producing an opposite effect

‍BUREAUCRACY.Definition: a system for controlling or managing a country, company, or organisation that is operated by a large number of officials employed to follow rules carefully

‍POVERTY LINE.Definition: the official level of income that is needed to achieve a basic living standard with enough money for things such as food, clothing, and a place to live

‍MAJORITY.Definition: the larger number or part of something

‍SHAREHOLDINGS.Definition: the shares in a company that a particular person or organization owns considered together as a unit

‍SPECTRUM.Definition: a range of different positions, opinions, etc. between two extreme points

‍LIBERTARIANS.Definition: people who believe that people should be free to think and behave as they want and should not have limits put on them by governments

‍PUSHING FOR.Definition: to demand something repeatedly, or to take strong action to try to make it happen

‍PROPONENT.Definition: a person who speaks publicly in support of a particular idea or plan of action

‍SIGNATURE.Definition: used to refer to the special thing for which a person or place is particularly known

‍REGARDLESS.Definition: despite; not being affected by something

‍NEOLIBERAL.Definition: supporting a large amount of freedom for markets, with little government control or spending, and low taxes

‍TOP-UP.Definition: an extra amount of something, especially money, that is added to an existing amount to create the total you need

‍EXTENSIVELY.Definition: in a way that covers a large area or has a great range

Definition: Outcomesa result or effect of an action, situation, etc.

‍OUTSPOKEN.Definition: expressing strong opinions very directly without worrying if other people are offended

‍WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people

‍ADOPTION.Definition: accepting or starting to use something new

‍TOUCHED ON.Definition: to mention a subject quickly when speaking or writing about another subject

‍ASSESSING.Definition: to judge or decide the amount, value, quality, or importance of something

‍BETTER OFF.Definition: to have more money than you had in the past or more money than most other people

‍VEHEMENTLY.Definition: in a strong and emotional way

‍IMPLEMENTING.Definition: to start using a plan or system

‍FACTOR IN.Definition: to include something when you are doing a calculation, or when you are trying to understand something

‍WELFARE.Definition: a system of payments made by the government to people who are ill, poor, or who have no job

‍BACKSIDES.Definition: the part of the body that you sit on

‍HANDOUT.Definition: something such as food, clothing, or money that is given free to someone who has a great need for it

‍INCENTIVE.Definition: something that encourages a person to do something

‍VICIOUS CYCLE.Definition: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

‍INFLATION.Definition: a general, continuous increase in prices

‍GET BY.Definition: to be able to live or deal with a situation with difficulty, usually by having just enough of something you need, such as money

‍VICIOUS CIRCLE.Definition: a continuing unpleasant situation, created when one problem causes another problem that then makes the first problem worse

‍SUBSISTENCE.Definition: the state of having what you need in order to stay alive, but no more

‍COUNTER ARGUMENT.Definition: an argument against another argument, idea, or suggestion

‍PERSUASIVE.Definition: to make someone do or believe something by giving them a good reason to do it or by talking to that person and making them believe it

‍DEEMED.Definition: considered or judged in a particular way

‍COMPELLING.Definition: if a reason, argument, etc. is compelling, it makes you believe it or accept it because it is so strong
